data.title: 25 Tourist Places in Thailand: Tourist Attractions & Famous Places to Visit
data.meta_description: Top Tourist Places to Visit in Thailand: Know about the top tourist attractions in Thailand, including beaches and islands, rainforests and other relevant details.
data.text:
Every year millions of people visit Thailand to experience this diverse country and its unique tourist destinations. Thailand proudly presents its natural gems, here is a list of some of those picturesque beaches and islands.

1. Phi Phi Islands, Phuket

Consisting of six islands together, Phi Phi Island has a lot to offer tourists. The island is known for its nightlife and crazy party atmosphere. If partying is not for you, then simply head to the island to soak in the sun and enjoy the beautiful beaches.

Location: Krabi, Phuket

Timing: Open 24 hours

Entry Fees: 868.04 THB

2. Krabi, Thailand

If you’re looking for a relaxing holiday to enjoy some quiet, head to the beautiful Krabi, one of the most popular beach destinations in Thailand. Known for its mesmerising views and glorious sunsets, here you can also shop and experience the nightlife of the place.

Location: Southern Thailand

Timing: Open 24 hours

Entry Fees: No entry fees

3. Coral Island, Pattaya

The coral island in Pattaya, popularly known by its local name, Koh Hae is only 3 km from southeast Phuket. This island has two famous beaches, Banana Beach and Long Beach. It is heaven for beach lovers. Here, you can enjoy water adventure sports like snorkelling, or simply rent lounge chairs and relax.

Location: Bang Lamung District

Timing: 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM

Entry Fees: No entry fees

4. Racha Yai Island, Phuket

The other name of the Racha Yai island is Ko Racha Yai. This place is around 12 km from Phuket and Bangkok, and is ideal for diving, snorkelling and fishing tours. Besides adventure sports and mesmerising sceneries, you also get delicious food from local restaurants. A small bay on the west coast here is famous for fishing.

Location: Rawai, Mueang Phuket District

Timing: Open 24 hours

Entry Fees: No entry fees

5. Similan Islands, Phuket

Similan Islands are located 84 km from Phuket. This place is gradually becoming one of the favourite spots for divers. You can visit 2-3 islands here, and take photographs in the sandy beaches and huge boulders. However, there is a lack of regular boat services to this island, so make sure to check the availability before planning to visit it.

Location: Phang Nga, Phuket

Timing: 8:30 AM to 3:00 PM

Entry Fees: 439.88 THB

6. Koh Samui, Thailand

Koh Samui’s popular beaches, Lamai and Chewang, are known for their nightlife but can get quite crowded during the peak season. The secluded Silver Beach, which lies close to Chaweng and Lamai, is another popular tourist attraction that you can explore.

Location: Surat Thani Province

Timing: Open 24 hours

Entry Fees: No entry fees

7. Jomtien Beach, Thailand

If you are planning to spend a day at a quiet and secluded beach, Jomtien Beach is ideal for you. It is a 6 km long beachfront, known for being clean and family-friendly. You can enjoy the stunning views around the beach, or go sunbathing. There are several restaurants along the beach, where you can go to grab delicious snacks.

Location: Chonburi Province, Thailand

Timing: Open 24 hours

Entry Fees: No entry fees

8. Railay Beach, Thailand

This is also one of the secluded beaches in Thailand. The main attractions of this beach include the caves, limestone cliffs, lagoons and viewpoints. Moreover, you can enjoy various activities here, including kayaking, hiking, snorkelling, swimming and rock climbing. This place is perfect for a laid-back day to relax and unwind.

Location: Ao Nang, Mueang Krabi District

Timing: Open 24 hours

Entry Fees: No entry fees

9. Freedom Beach, Phuket

With a 300 m long belt of white sandy beach, Freedom beach is one of the best-hidden gems of Phuket. As it is a secluded beach and not yet crowded with tourists, you can expect to spend a calm and peaceful time on the beach. You can also go snorkelling, or play beach volleyball or soccer.

Location: Pa Tong, Kathu District

Timing: Open 24 hours

Entry Fees: 120 THB-200 THB

10. Patong Beach, Phuket

Patong is popular among tourists for hosting frequent fun parties on the beach. Besides partying, you can also visit different restaurants, bars, massage parlours, cabarets or nightclubs. In addition, you can also try different water sports to try adventure sports like snorkelling, scuba diving, jet skiing, etc.

Location: West coast, Phuket Island

Timing: 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM

Entry Fees: No entry fees

Some may have a misconception that people visit Thailand only for beaches. However, there are several temples and architectural structures which are worth exploring.

11. Sanctuary of Truth, Pattaya

One of the most iconic structures in Pattaya, the Sanctuary of Truth is locally known as Prasat Sut Ja-Tum. This magnificent temple is completely made of teak wood. Despite being an incomplete structure, it is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Pattaya. Here, you can see a brilliant architectural work combining philosophy, mythology and craftsmanship.

Location: Pattaya-Naklua, Bang Lamung District

Timing: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM

Entry Fees: 500 THB

12. Ayutthaya, Thailand

A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Ayutthaya is like an open-air museum. The structures found here date back centuries. The place is known for its rich architecture. It’s a great place to learn about the glorious past of the country.

Location: Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya District

Timing: 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM.

Entry Fees: 50 THB

13. White Temple, Chiang Rai

The white temple in Chiang Rai, locally known as the Wat Rong Khun, is evidence of culture and architectural excellence. There are multiple metaphorical details included in the design. One of the highlights of this temple is the ordination hall, which is a stunning white building with fragments of reflective glass.

Location: Phahonyothin Road, Pa O Don Chai, Mueang Chiang Rai District

Timing: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM

Entry Fees: 50 THB

14. The Grand Palace, Phra Nakhon

The grand palace is a magnificent monument. It is not just a tourist attraction spot but the home to the Thai king. This palace serves the royal court and is the administrative seat of the government. Furthermore, it represents the spiritual heart of the kingdom. Here you will find the emerald Buddha Statue, regionally called Wat Phra Kaew.

Location: Na Phra Lan Road in the Phra Nakhon area

Timing: 8:30 AM to 3:30 PM

Entry Fees: 500 THB

15. Wat Arun, Bangkok

Wat Arun or the temple of the Dawn is another popular tourist attraction. This Buddhist temple is 260 ft high and located above the Chao Phraya River. It is a great location to witness beautiful sunrises or sunsets. A major highlight here is the prang (spire) by the Chao Phraya, a 70 m high spire with stunning decorations of coloured glass and Chinese porcelain.

Location: Thanon Wang Doem, Wat Arun, Bangkok Yai

Timing: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM

Entry Fees: 100 THB

16. Wat Pho Temple, Bangkok

Thailand is also known to attract tourists from all over the world for its popular temples. Make a trip to the famous Wat Pho, known for traditional Thai healing and medicine. Also home to the popular reclining Buddha, a trip here will leave you very satisfied.

Location: Phra Nakhon District

Timing: 8:30 AM to 5:30 AM

Entry Fees: 100 THB

Thailand has something to offer to everyone. So, if you prefer wildlife and natural landscapes, there are plenty of options to explore in Thailand.

17. Kanchanaburi, Thailand

Kanchanaburi has gained popularity for its picturesque waterfalls and national parks. Mon Bridge and Khao Laem Lake are two of its main tourist attractions. However, some prefer visiting this town for WWII War Museum. Ideally, you can spend three to four days in Kanchanaburi.

Location: Mueang Kanchanaburi District

Timing: No specific timing

Entry Fees: No entry fee

18. Khao Yai National Park, Thailand

There are so many beautiful tourist places in Thailand, and Khao Yai National Park is one of the best among them. Some main attractions at the park are the pythons, asian elephants, bears, and gibbons. Here, you can enjoy camping and spend the whole night in the jungle.

Location: Mu Si, Pak Chong District

Timing: 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM

Entry Fees: 20 THB for children. 40 THB for adults, Free for elders and disabled people

19. Khao Sok National Park, Thailand

UNESCO has enlisted this national park as a heritage site in Thailand. This national park is set in a backdrop of lush forests and rugged mountains, attracting tourists with its beautiful waterfalls and exotic wildlife. Besides going on a jungle safari in this park, you may also check out Khao Yai Art Museum, which is located in the same region.

Location: Khlong Sok, Phanom District

Timing: 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM

Entry Fees: 300 THB

20. Khao Laem National Park

Khao Laem National Park is among the ideal places to explore flora and fauna in Thailand. It is a nature lover's paradise. The most unique feature of this national park is that you can stay here on houseboats. Other nearby tourist attractions are Khao Laem lake, Koreng Kra Wia, and Kra Teng Jeng.

Location: Prang Phe, Sangkhla Buri District

Timing: 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM

Entry Fees: 100 THB for children, 200 THB for adults
